title: Airbus takes 1.3 bln euros charge on A400M military plane
text: February 15, 2018 / 5:42 AM / Updated 37 minutes ago Airbus takes 1.3 bln euros charge on A400M military plane Reuters Staff 1 Min Read PARIS, Feb 15 (Reuters) - Airbus on Thursday took a 1.3 billion euros ($1.6 billion) writedown on its A400M military transport plane, lifting cumulative charges on Europe’s troubled defence project above 8 billion euros and clouding higher-than-expected underlying profits. Europe’s largest aerospace group posted adjusted 2017 operating profit of 4.253 billion euros on revenues of 66.767 billion euros and predicted a 20 percent rise in adjusted operating income in 2018. Analysts were on average expecting adjusted 2017 operating profits of 3.996 billion euros and revenues of 67.343 billion, according to a poll conducted for Reuters. $1 = 0.8028 euros Reporting by Tim Hepher Editing by Sudip Kar-Gupta
